results.title: Wharfie
results.creator_credit: Barbara Boyd-Anderson and A Fitzroy Flix Film
results.brief_description: Impressionistic, non-narrated study of Melbourne Waterfront in which and old ex-wharfie returns to the wharves with his grandson to be confronted by vast technological changes. Still photographs and newspaper headlines refer back to more boisterous days when the wharves employed many more men.

results.title: Shrink proofing wool
results.creator_credit: D.G. Corke, P. Bruce, S.T. Evans and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Describes early attempts to make wool shrink-resistant by chlorination and comments on some adverse effects of this process. It goes on toe cover CSIROs research efforts culminating in a coating technique using a resin polyamide epichlorhydrin. This method is used commercially and renders wool completely shrink proof. Reference is made to the parallel development of a method of continuous dyeing of wool and that these developments are compatible.
results.creator_credit_for_label: D.G. Corke, P. Bruce, S.T. Evans and CSIRO

results.title: Rodeo cowboy
results.brief_description: Takes an intimate look at the men who make their living riding in rodeos, their dreams, their disappointments and their physical injuries. Being a rodeo cowboy is an adventurous and challenging life and although only a few ever make any real money, most would not trade for anything else. The camaraderie and dependence of friend upon friend and man upon animal are the motivations that hold them together. Photographed by Rick Freidberg and Mort “Kai” Schuman. Features soundtrack of original songs by Tim McIntire.

results.title: Puppet animation
results.creator_credit: David Johnson, Eric Halliday, Mark Sanders, Nancy Wahlquist and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A sequel to “The Animation game” (T/Code 015386) that examines and demonstrates the many possibilities of puppet animation. Produced in a humorous and stylistically appealing manner. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Fungi and man
results.brief_description: Shows how fungi can alter the physical and chemical structure of organic materials in the environment, including humans themselves, in ways both chemical and harmful. Provides clear photography of fungi physiology.

results.title: Cold comfort
results.creator_credit: Damian Brown, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Highlights the potential danger from bacteria if frozen food is incorrectly handled. The key is to maintain strict temperature control. Covers all aspects from the handling of fresh food by the processor through freezing, storage transportation in refrigerated containers or trucks, handling by supermarkets and other sales outlets, transportation by the consumer and handling in the home. Suitabvle for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Baked bean story
results.brief_description: This film shows the various steps involved in the production of the famous British “delicacy” of baked beans from their beginnings on an Ontario farm to the time when they are devoured as part of a typical English meal. A useful example of vertically integrated food processing and the importance of quality control in manufacturing. Suitable for Upper Primary-Lower Secondary students. No other credits available.

results.title: Fashion from start to finish
results.brief_description: Butterick, “Vogue” and “See’n Sew” are together the world’s largest pattern house. The film examines the role of each person involved in the design and manufacture of patterns. An advertisment for “Butterick”, but a fast-moving comprehensive coverage. No other credits. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Turn a handle, flick a switch. - 2nd rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Shows how basic domestic services, such as gas, electricity and water are provided. Deals with the source of these services, their reticulation and home usage. The program ends with a strong conservation message - “turn off the light, etc.” Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: A Red ribbon
results.creator_credit: Marc De Rossi, Patricia De Rossi, Pedro Jose Frank Nemeth and Ard Norddeutscher Rundfunk
results.brief_description: A non-narrated story with simply a musical score background about a young boy’s unsuccessful attempts to fly a kite. Discouraged he gives up and goes home. However, his female companion comes to his rescue with the aid of her red hair ribbon which she attaches to the tail of the kite. A sensitive film that raises issues about the value of friendship and co-operation. Music by Vincente Salvia. Cast: Ledice Fernandes de Oliviera, Marcos da Silva. Suitable for primary school level.
